intro: Poranthera ericifolia, commonly known as the wooly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas. Poranthera ericifolia is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant once established.
